PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a caldera (about 10 km in diameter) located in the Aleutian Range of Alaska, United States. The area around
is the Aniakchak National Monument and Preserve, maintained by the National Park Service.
is an extant volcano - at least ten lava flows have occurred since the formation of the caldera in 1645 B.C.; the most recent was in 1931.
Surprise Lake within the caldera is the source of the Aniakchak River, a National Wild River.
was designated as a National Natural Landmark by the National Park Service.
